node.title: Don't Want to Get Spam Emails - Use Mailinator Instead
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
These days you need your email address in almost all the website for the sign-up purpose. 

​Now you never know the personal email ids which you share in these websites are shared or not with others. Some share the email ids or some might sell it, if they do it then you might get tons of spam emails.

​This is where Mailinator comes into picture. Millinator is a free service which gives you an email address instantly and that email address will be destroyed after few hours.

![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmcCc43nsgNRfo5UjMgtvyxDo8Do5B4FzU1gynkduAp4vp/image.png)
PC : https://www.mailinator.com/

One more thing is that you can create as many as email address and just stop worrying about the spam emails. 

FAQ from their Website

### >What is Mailinator?

>The Public Mailinator site is a different kind of email service. The biggest difference is that you don't need to sign up. Any email name you can think of already exists @mailinator.com and you can use any of them. Want BrianTheSkink@mailinator.com? You got it. Want PrettyMothra? ScaryGavyn? No problem. Those and any other mailboxes you think of @mailinator.com are created when email arrives! Really. Other differences of the Public Mailinator system include:

>All Emails automatically delete after a few hours
>You cannot SEND from Mailinator - it is a receive-only service
>All email is public. Really - very very public. All Email is readable by anyone and no one "owns" an inbox or emails.

I think it is very good in terms of reducing the Spam Emails in your personal email addresses

node.body:
This is my second entry for the B&W photo contest initiated by @daveks and sponsored by @papa-pepper.

node.title: Let's discuss - Should you change your passwords regularly?
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
You might have heard a lot of time that "Change your passwords regularly", but I would like to ask you that how often you change your passwords and why and should you on the first place change your passwords regularly?

https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2017/01/04/13/42/internet-1952019_960_720.jpg

PC: Pixabay.com

It's a good advice but it is not a rule that you should change your passwords regularly. Why usually people give the advice to change the passwords because then someone who has acquired your password cannot have access to your important documents for a longer period of time.

Why on Earth, anyone would wait for an extended period of time to keep track of you. If they got your Bank Account Password, they can certainly transfer the money now and will not wait for an extended period of time. So tell me changing  the password regularly is good or bad?

Now let's say you change the passwords regularly, if a hacker got your password on the first place then its a high probability that they will get your passwords again in the future as well.

Bdw somewhere changing passwords comes in handy, for say your friend wants to debug an application of yours and need an admin password for a short duration, then it might help because you don't want them to use your passwords for a long period of time.

What you think should changing the password regularly is a good practice or not?

node.title: Login in Windows System Without Keyboard
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
Have you ever experienced that your Keyboard is down and you cannot login to your windows system because you cannot write your password?

It happened to me in the past. I did not know that Microsoft had included a way in your login screen which allows you to log in just by using the mouse, or if you have a touchscreen system then you can use that to login to the Windows System.

Let's see how we can use just your mouse to log in. Just open up your laptop like normal and then look for a symbol as shown below which is the Ease of Access Center.

​

![ "IMG_20171023_ 211209.jpg"](https://steemitimages.com/DQmWGtqTQ5rcf5xtCYo5k8ed9Mt14CxWwwXpvXaFBskcv4j/IMG_20171023\__211209.jpg)

​

When you click on Ease of Access Center button you will see a lot of options like Hear text on screen read aloud, make items on screen larger and similarly you will see Type without the keyword i.e. On Screen Keyboard.

​

![ "IMG_20171023_ 221629.jpg"](https://steemitimages.com/DQme7cVxxscXWA6yvuDt1TcxzoXcPa57oe2fsfSqR4mWrGh/IMG_20171023\__221629.jpg)

​

When you click on On Screen Keyborad you will get the Keyboard On the Screen and it will have the same functionality as the normal keyboard.

​

![ "IMG_20171023_ 221651.jpg"](https://steemitimages.com/DQmQCu2n9e64x7i5hW8UgR85wbTr38FNYchdSdPd5nP3cKQ/IMG_20171023\__221651.jpg)

​

<hr>

​

### Follow @codingdefined

​

<hr>
